description:
Join our dynamic team and make a meaningful impact across a vast 46,620-kilometer region spanning eastern Ontario and western Quebec, including Ottawa, Canada.
As a key player in community service, the Anglican Diocese of Ottawa (ADO) serves over 50 local communities with a focus on social connection, spiritual nourishment, social justice, and compassionate service. We're seeking a dedicated Donor Relations and Development Officer to play a pivotal role in our development and stewardship strategy. The purpose of this role is to nurture affinity through stewardship to cultivate key partners, volunteers, and donors' continued support of ADO initiatives and ministries.
Who We Need
Reporting to the Director of Communications and Development, you would be an integral part of working in an innovative, collaborative, small team environment. You’ll cultivate and maintain positive relationships with internal and external partners, fostering continued engagement and support. This includes supporting our parish ministries and community ministries of Belong Ottawa, Centre 105, Cornerstone Housing for Women, Ottawa Pastoral Counselling Centre, and Refugee Ministry Office as well as initiatives like our affordable housing projects (e.g. Hollyer House, Ellwood House).
Who You AreYou are excited to grow in the nonprofit space and are looking for a role where you can showcase your exceptional communication skills and high standards in donor relations activities, including maintaining accurate donor information in the donor database.
Your drive will spark the vital financial support required for our community initiatives and ministries to thrive. You have experience in the areas of grant development and fundraising. You’re ready to make an impact on stewardship and introduce new ways to engage donors. It’s an exciting time to join the team and contribute to building strategies and processes.
As our new Donor Relations and Development Officer, you will:

 Focus on donor experience: You will own the space around donor relations, research, build, and nurture relationships with individual, corporate, and partnering donors.
 Collaborate to achieve development goals: You will support development efforts by strategizing and implementing stewardship, donor cultivation, and engagement strategies.
 Track and Report: You will oversee online donations and maintain donor database with accuracy and process donations, issue receipts, prepare financial reconciliation reports, and analyze, create, and provide regular tracking reports (Raiser’s Edge)

Your Skills & Qualifications:

 Post Secondary education: business, non-profit management, communications, marketing, or related field, or a blend of relevant experience and education.
 Demonstrated Experience: Proven track record and tangible examples showcasing capabilities and achievements in the relevant areas of the role.
 Communications skills and relationship building: Excellent written and verbal skills; strong ability to cultivate and maintain positive relationships with key partners, donors, volunteers
 Project management, business development, and results driven: demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously; track record of achieving and exceeding development and financial goals
 Ethical Standards: Adherence to ethical stewardship, fundraising practices, and commitment to maintaining donor confidentiality
 CRM database management: Proficiency in using Customer Relationship Management (CRM) databases for effective donor tracking and relationship management; skilled in generating reports to analyze campaign performance and inform strategic decision making.
 Business development, sales, advertising, or marketing experience would be considered a plus for this role.

Perks & Benefits
We offer comprehensive healthcare and dental coverage, and a defined benefit pension plan with generous employer contribution. You'll be part of a collaborative work environment that celebrates innovation and diversity. Enjoy work-life balance with a generous compensation package that includes a 35-hour workweek and 3 weeks of vacation.
Excited about the role? Apply! We welcome diverse experiences and backgrounds. While certain qualifications are essential, we value a range of experiences. Click on "Apply for This Position" and submit your application.
We're dedicated to reviewing applications promptly and would look forward to receiving yours!
While all applications will be gratefully received, only individuals selected for further consideration will be contacted.
Our organization is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, veteran status, or disability. We will accommodate the needs of applicants under the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please advise during the search process if you require accommodation by contacting us at hr@ottawa.anglican.ca
